content.description: A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></math>-test for a population proportion <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be conducted. Which of the following conditions checks that the sampling distribution of the sample proportion is approximately normal?
content.question: The sample is selected at random.<math alttext="n times p sub 0 is greater than or equal to 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>≥</mo><mtext>10</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="n times, open parenthesis, 1 minus p sub 0, close parenthesis, is greater than or equal to 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>(</mo><mtext>1</mtext><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo><mo>≥</mo><mtext>10</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for sample size <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.The sample size is less than or equal to 10 percent of the population size.

choices.label: <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> only

<math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>III</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Verify that inference procedures apply in a given situation.
